subtitulo: Machine Learning Application for Sports Performance Prediction
descripcion: This application uses advanced artificial intelligence techniques to predict athletic performance based on multiple athlete characteristics. It includes comprehensive exploratory analysis, multiple ML algorithms, robust statistical evaluation, and report generation.
nota: **Note:** Place your `datasport.csv` file in the same directory as this application, or use the file upload option in the sidebar.
descripcion_datos: Upload a CSV file with your sports data.
no_datos_disponibles: No data available. Please upload a CSV file or use the sample data.
preprocesamiento_completado: Preprocessing complete. You can continue with model training.
no_datos_cargados: No data loaded. Please upload a CSV file or use the sample data.
conclusion_prueba_kruskal: **Conclusion:** There are significant differences between the models
error_comparacion_post_hoc: Post-hoc analysis could not be performed:
no_conclusion_prueba_kruskal: **Conclusion:** There are no significant differences between the models
reporte_texto_resumen: This report presents a comprehensive analysis of athletic performance prediction using machine learning techniques. Multiple algorithms were evaluated, and the best model was identified based on statistically robust performance metrics.
reporte_descripcion_texto_dataset: The dataset contains information about {self.datos.shape[0]} athletes with {self.datos.shape[1]} different characteristics. Variables include physiological, training, and historical performance metrics.
reporte_descripcion_variables_principale:
Main variables:
• Physiological variables: BMI, heart rate, VO2 Max
• Training variables: training hours, intensity
• Lifestyle variables: sleep, nutrition, hydration
• Target variable: Performance_Metric
reporte_resultado_mejor_modelo: The model {nombre_mejor_modelo} demonstrated the best performance with the following metrics:
reporte_interpretacion_texto: The model explains approximately {resultados_mejor_modelo['R² Test']*100:.1f}% of variability in sports performance. The average absolute error is {resultados_mejor_modelo['MAE Test']:.2f} units in the performance metric.</para>
reporte_conclusiones_01: Optimal model: {nombre_mejor_modelo} showed the best predictive performance.
reporte_conclusiones_02: Predictive capacity: The model can explain {resultados_mejor_modelo['R² Test']*100:.1f}% of variability in sports performance.
reporte_conclusiones_03: Hardiness: Cross-validation confirms the stability of the model. ({resultados_mejor_modelo['CV Media']:.4f} ± {resultados_mejor_modelo['CV Desv. Est.']:.4f}).
reporte_recomendaciones_01: Implementation: It is recommended to implement the model {nombre_mejor_modelo} for sports performance predictions.
reporte_recomendaciones_02: Continuous monitoring: Regularly monitor performance and adjust the model as needed.
reporte_recomendaciones_03: Future improvements: Consider collecting additional data and periodically re-evaluating the model.
reporte_recomendaciones_04: Key variables: Focus efforts on accurately collecting the most predictive variables identified in the analysis.
